short_summary: Professional Tire Safety Testing and Evaluation
description: The specification is to provide professional tire safety testing and evaluation. The evaluation includes testing of tires for wet grip, snow traction, rolling resistance, and other tire safety variables.
full_summary:
**Title:** ACAN - Professional Tire Safety Testing and Evaluation
**Reference Number:** PW-22-01012254
**Publication Date:** November 2, 2022
**Closing Date:** November 16, 2022 at 15:00 (ET)

**Background:**
The Government of Canada aims to enhance the safety and efficiency of the transportation system. The innovation Centre of Transport Canada is working in collaboration with governments, industry, and academics to test and evaluate the safety and environmental performance of new vehicle technologies in Canada.

**Tender Description:**
This Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN) invites the supplier community to submit a Statement of Capabilities for Professional Tire Safety Testing and Evaluation. The Contractor will be assessed based on their testing capabilities for performing tire tests as specified in international standards, such as ISO and AST.

**Scope of Work:**
The Contractor is expected to:

* Provide qualified personnel, facilities, materials, supplies, and equipment to perform and manage the testing.
* Conduct tire tests, including rolling resistance, wet traction, and snow traction.
* Provide test fixtures and equipment.
* Maintain suitable calibration systems and laboratory conditions.
* Maintain communication with Transport Canada and provide technical discussions and consultations.

**Exclusions:**
The tender is subject to limited tendering due to the absence of competition for technical reasons.

**Contract Period:**
The proposed contract period will be from the date of contract award to March 31, 2025.

**Estimated Cost:**
The estimated maximum value of the proposed contract is $300,000 CAD (taxes included).

**Contact Information:**
Name: Anthony Senauth
Title: Specialist Procurement
Contact: anthony.senauth@tc.gc.ca
Phone: 204-590-8905

**Important Notes:**

* Suppliers who consider themselves fully qualified and available to provide the services/bienes described herein may submit a Statement of Capabilities in writing, preferably by e-mail.
* A statement of capabilities must clearly demonstrate how the supplier meets the advertised requirements.
* Only the suppliers that have submitted a response will be notified in writing of TC’s decision to continue with the non-competitive procurement or to compete for the requirement. 
* This procurement is subject to various trade agreements, including the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).

**Contact Information:**  
Anthony Senauth  
Specialist Procurement  
Transport Canada

204-590-8905
